days.theme: Hike day (Ella Rock) + relaxed local food

itinerary.summary: 3-day low-budget, family-safe nature-and-food trip based in Ella. Mix of short hikes (Little Adam’s Peak), classic viewpoints (Nine Arch area), waterfalls (Kuda Ravana/Kital Ella), and local cafés. Weather looks cool and cloudy (~18–19°C), good for walking with a light jacket.
tips: Start hikes early (before 08:00) to avoid crowds and to get clearer views before clouds build.
Carry a light rain jacket and a warm layer; evenings can feel chilly around Ella.
Use tuk-tuks for short transfers (town ↔ trailheads/waterfalls) to save time and energy; agree on price before starting.
For Nine Arch Bridge views, aim for early morning; ask your hotel about train times for a better chance to see one pass.
Drink bottled/filtered water and carry snacks for hikes (bananas, king coconut, short eats).

total_budget.notes: Estimates per person for 3 days in Ella (excluding long-distance transport to/from Ella). Low budget assumes guesthouse dorm/basic room share, mostly local meals, walking + occasional tuk-tuk. Mid/high include more tuk-tuks, paid viewpoints/swings, and nicer cafés.

warnings: Hiking trails can be slippery after rain; wear shoes with grip and avoid cliff edges.
At popular photo spots (swings/view decks), confirm all fees before paying and keep valuables secured.
Waterfall rocks are slippery and currents can be dangerous; keep children close and avoid wading in fast water.

days.theme: Easy nature + light museums + flexible departure day

itinerary.summary: 3-day balanced, family-safe Kandy itinerary focusing on cultural highlights around the Temple of the Tooth, gardens in Peradeniya, viewpoints, and an easy nature walk. Weather is warm and humid (~24°C, cloudy), so plan light rain cover and mid-day breaks.
tips: Start Temple of the Tooth visits early to avoid crowds; dress modestly (shoulders/knees covered) and bring socks (shoes off in temple areas).
Use tuk-tuks for short hops in town; negotiate or use metered/ride-hailing where available. A short private car is best for Peradeniya.
Carry water, sunscreen, and a light rain jacket/umbrella; humidity is high and showers are possible.
Keep some cash for tickets, donations, and parking; many small places don’t take cards.
Plan a mid-day rest when it’s warmest; do viewpoints late afternoon for best light.

total_budget.notes: Approx total for 2 adults + 1 child staying in Kandy for 3 days excluding flights. Includes mid-range hotel (2 nights), local transport (tuk-tuk/car), attraction tickets/donations, and meals. Costs vary by hotel choice and whether you use a private car vs tuk-tuks.

warnings: Watch for monkeys at Udawatta Kele Sanctuary—do not feed them and keep bags closed.
Temple and museum areas can be crowded; keep valuables secure and stay together with children.
Roads in Kandy are busy and narrow; allow buffer time for traffic especially around the lake and city center.

itinerary.summary: 3-day, balanced-pace family-friendly getaway based in Nuwara Eliya, focusing on parks, viewpoints, gentle hikes, and waterfalls. Expect cool, cloudy hill-country weather (~16°C), so pack warm layers and rain protection.
tips: Bring a light jacket/hoodie and a rain jacket; evenings can feel cold in Nuwara Eliya.
Start viewpoints early morning for clearer skies; clouds roll in fast.
Use tuk-tuks for short hops in town; for Moon Plains and remote falls, hire a car with driver for half-day/full-day for comfort and time savings.
Carry cash for small entry tickets/parking and local snack stalls; ATMs can be busy on weekends.
If traveling with kids, keep a spare set of warm clothes after lake activities due to wind chill.

total_budget.notes: Estimate for 2 adults + 1 child for 3 days in Nuwara Eliya (excluding flights). Includes mid-range lodging, meals, local transport by tuk-tuk/private car, and entry fees/activities. Costs vary by hotel choice, vehicle type, and paid activities at Gregory Lake.

warnings: Waterfall trails can be slippery in cloudy/wet conditions—wear grippy shoes and avoid standing close to edges.
Moon Plains can be windy and chilly; keep children close near viewpoints.
Roads are narrow with sharp bends; plan conservative travel times and avoid late-night long drives.

itinerary.summary: 3 chill days based in Kandy focusing on the Temple of the Tooth area, lakeside viewpoints, light nature walks, and Peradeniya gardens. All activities are family-safe, mostly walkable or short tuk-tuk rides. Weather is warm and humid with clouds (~24°C feels-like).
tips: Start Temple of the Tooth visits early to avoid crowds; dress modestly (shoulders/knees covered) and bring socks for hot paving.
Use tuk-tuks for short hops; agree on a metered fare or price before starting.
For Udawatta Kele, go in daylight and stick to main paths; carry water due to humidity.
Carry small cash for tickets and donations; many small counters don’t take cards.
Plan viewpoints near sunset but leave a little buffer for traffic around the lake.

total_budget.notes: Estimates for 1 person for 3 days in Kandy (budget guesthouse, local meals, tuk-tuks within town, and standard entry fees). Excludes long-distance transport to/from Kandy and private driver hire. Costs vary by nationality-based ticketing and how many paid museums you choose.

warnings: Humidity is high; take breaks and hydrate, especially during midday walks.
Monkeys can be present near forested areas—don’t feed them and secure bags/food.
Roads around Kandy can be congested; allow extra time even for short distances.
Watch belongings in crowded areas around the Temple and markets.

days.theme: Signature hike (choose your effort) + final viewpoints

itinerary.summary: 3 chill, low-budget days based in Ella with easy hikes, viewpoints and nearby waterfalls/cave. Weather is cool and cloudy (~18–19°C), so pack a light rain layer and start hikes early.
tips: Start Little Adam’s Peak and Ella Rock early for cooler temps and clearer views (clouds often build later).
Use tuk-tuks for short hops (town to trailheads); agree on price before starting or use meter if available.
Carry cash; some small eateries and tuk-tuks don’t take cards.
Wear grippy shoes—trails can be muddy/slippery after rain.
Bring a reusable water bottle and snacks for hikes; shops are limited on the trails.

total_budget.notes: Estimate for 1 person for 3 days in Ella (excluding long-distance transport to/from Ella). Low: budget guesthouse + local meals + small entrance/transport. Mid/High allow more tuk-tuk use, nicer rooms, and paid viewpoints.

warnings: Avoid hiking Ella Rock in heavy rain or fog—paths can be confusing and slippery.
At waterfalls and rocks, keep distance from edges; surfaces can be slick.
Watch for leeches after rain on forested trails; consider socks/repellent.
Tuk-tuk drivers may quote high prices for tourists—confirm total cost before riding.

items.description: Family-friendly hike to the iconic viewpoint. Go early for the best chance of clear views. Take it slow on muddy sections if it has rained.
items.title: Little Adam's Peak (sunrise-friendly hike)

items.description: Quick photo stop at a nearby viewpoint around the Little Adam’s Peak area; good option if clouds open briefly.
items.location: Little adam's peak View Point, Ella
items.title: Viewpoint stop (near Little Adam's Peak)

items.description: Light waterfall visit close to Ella. Enjoy the scenery and photos; avoid slippery rocks near the base.
items.title: Waterfall visit (short, relaxing)

items.description: Wind down with a slow walk through Ella town, souvenir shops and cafes. Great for families and an easy pace day.
items.title: Evening stroll in Ella town

meals.suggestion: Hotel breakfast or a simple egg hopper/string hoppers set
Rice & curry (ask for mild options for kids) or kottu
Sri Lankan rice & curry or grilled chicken/veg at a family-friendly cafe

cost_range.notes: Mid includes extra tuk-tuk time for cave/waterfall and optional local guide for Ella Rock (price varies).

days.hotel_area: Ella town (easy return after hiking; good dining options)

items.description: More challenging hike than Little Adam’s Peak with uneven paths and possible navigation confusion. Start early; carry water and snacks. Turn back if weather closes in.
items.title: Ella Rock hike (start early; consider a local guide)

items.description: Return to your hotel to rest, shower, and dry off after the hike (useful in cool, humid weather).
items.title: Rest and refresh

items.description: Visit the cave associated with local legends. There are steps and uneven ground; keep kids close and use phone lights carefully.
items.title: Ravana’s Cave (steps + short exploration)

items.description: Quick look at a smaller nearby waterfall on the way back; skip if rain is heavy or rocks are too slick.
items.title: Short waterfall stop (if energy allows)

meals.suggestion: Early breakfast + packed snack (banana, buns) for the hike
Hearty rice & curry or noodles; choose mild spice level
Soup/noodles or a lighter meal after hiking

cost_range.notes: Lower day cost if you keep it mostly in town; higher if you add extra tuk-tuk rides and a more upscale dinner.

days.hotel_area: Ella town (central, practical for a flexible last day)

items.description: Morning waterfall visit with minimal walking. Best for a relaxed final day; be cautious near wet rocks.
items.title: Kuda Ravana Ella waterfall

items.description: Pick a quick viewpoint stop for photos; ideal if clouds lift mid-morning.
items.title: Scenic viewpoint stop

items.description: Unstructured time for cafes, souvenirs, and relaxing. If it’s raining, keep activities close to town.
items.title: Free time: cafe hopping + shopping

items.description: If you’re continuing to Yala/Mirissa later, use a reputable local operator to arrange a safe car/van transfer and confirm start times.
items.title: Optional: book a trusted tuk-tuk for onward planning

meals.suggestion: Milk rice or roti with dhal + tea
Cafe lunch (sandwiches/pasta) or Sri Lankan short eats
Early dinner if traveling onward; choose a place near your hotel to avoid rain later

itinerary.summary: 3-day balanced, family-safe itinerary based in Ella focusing on easy hikes, viewpoints, and waterfalls. Weather is cool and cloudy (~17°C) with high humidity—expect mist and occasional showers.
tips: Start hikes early (before 08:00) for clearer views and cooler temperatures.
Carry a light rain jacket/poncho and a small towel; trails can be muddy and slippery in cloudy, humid conditions.
Use tuk-tuks for short hops (Ella town ↔ trailheads/viewpoints); confirm price before you ride or ask your hotel to arrange.
Wear shoes with grip for steps at Ravana’s Cave and wet rocks near waterfalls.
Keep some cash for parking/entry-style fees and small shops; card acceptance can be limited outside town.
If traveling with kids, prefer Little Adam’s Peak over Ella Rock (shorter, safer, fewer navigation issues).

total_budget.notes: Estimates for 2 adults for 3 days excluding long-distance transfers to/from Ella. Includes local tuk-tuk rides, entrance/parking fees, meals, and mid-range lodging. Costs vary by hotel standard and how many paid tours you add.

warnings: Waterfall rocks and edges are slippery; avoid climbing on wet boulders and keep children close.
Ella Rock route can be confusing; consider going with a local guide or start from the official trailhead and use offline maps.
Leeches can appear after rain on forest trails—carry leech socks or repellent and check ankles.
Fog can reduce visibility at viewpoints; have a flexible plan to swap activities between days.
